New Records: Bowden Francis had a career-high 12 strikeouts against the Los Angeles Angels on Aug. 24, 2024.
Francis' 0.40 WHIP is the lowest mark over a six-start span in MLB history.
Key Match Events: Bowden Francis was no-hitting the Mets through eight innings.
Francisco Lindor hit a game-tying solo home run in the ninth inning.
The Mets added five more runs in the ninth inning to win 6-2.
Post-Match Reflections: Blue Jays manager John Schneider praised Francis' performance despite the loss.
Francis reflected on his approach and the need to possibly alter his strategy in future similar situations.
Mets starter Sean Manaea acknowledged Francis' impressive performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Francis is positioning himself as a key piece of the Blue Jays' 2025 rotation.
Francis has won honours such as MLB Player of the Week and Player of the Month during his recent performance streak.
